p: National guidelines for a staged response (initial, early, late and emergency response to a dengue outbreak) were already incorporated in previous phases of this study [ 24], and carried forward into the current EWARS-R. Despite systematic integration of this action plan in the new EWARS-R, which can routinely report about appropriate response stage, further research is needed to provide evidence of the operational and cost-effectiveness of these actions and to develop clear indications about priority areas where to start and focus response actions when an alarm signal is reported (“hot spots”) [ 25].
